headline: Just 16, and on the Front Lines Of the Fight to Cure Sickle Cell
abstract: Helen Obando is the youngest person ever to get a gene therapy that scientists hope will cure the disease, which afflicts 100,000 Americans.
lead_paragraph: BOSTON â€” Helen Obando, a shy slip of a girl, lay curled in a hospital bed in June waiting for a bag of stem cells from her bone marrow, modified by gene therapy, to start dripping into her chest.
